solution_line_template: Grady gave {red_fraction_given} * {grady_red_cubes} cubes = <<{red_fraction_given}*{grady_red_cubes}={red_cubes_given_by_grady}>>{red_cubes_given_by_grady} of his red numbered cubes to Gage.

If Gage initially had {gage_initial_red_cubes} red numbered cubes, his total number of red numbered cubes became {gage_initial_red_cubes} cubes + {red_cubes_given_by_grady} cubes = <<{gage_initial_red_cubes}+{red_cubes_given_by_grady}={gage_total_red_cubes}>>{gage_total_red_cubes} cubes after Grady gave him {red_cubes_given_by_grady} more.
Grady also gave {blue_fraction_given} * {grady_blue_cubes} cubes = <<{blue_fraction_given}*{grady_blue_cubes}={blue_cubes_given_by_grady}>>{blue_cubes_given_by_grady} blue numbered cubes to Gage.

This increased Gage's total number of blue numbered cubes to {gage_initial_blue_cubes} cubes + {blue_cubes_given_by_grady} cubes = <<{gage_initial_blue_cubes}+{blue_cubes_given_by_grady}={gage_total_blue_cubes}>>{gage_total_blue_cubes} cubes
The total number of cubes Gage has is now {gage_total_blue_cubes} cubes + {gage_total_red_cubes} cubes = <<{gage_total_blue_cubes}+{gage_total_red_cubes}={gage_total_cubes}>>{gage_total_cubes} cubes
